Container.Name: Docker-Mailserver

Config.Name: SSL Type
Mount SSL Path
Config.Description: <b>Mounting path</b> where certs are stored <br>If <b>letsencrypt</b> is choosen as <b>SSL Type</b>, then path structure <b>must</b> look like this: <br> Host: /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/cert.files <br> Container: /etc/letsencrypt/live/

Config.Name: Key path
Config.Description: This is only supported with <b>`SSL_TYPE=manual`</b>. <br> Provide the path to your <b>key</b> file that you've mounted access to within the container.

Config.Name: Cert Path
Config.Description: This is only supported with <b>`SSL_TYPE=manual`</b>. <br> Provide the path to your <b>cert</b> file that you've mounted access to within the container.

Config.Name: Single state directory
Config.Description: 0 => mail state in default directories <br> 1 => consolidate all states into a single directory (`/var/mail-state`) to allow persistence using docker volumes

Config.Name: Spam to inbox
Config.Description: deliver spam messages in the inbox <br> 1 = Enable <br> 0 = Disable
